result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob H. Torkelson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Counselling as recommended by PO
Undergo sexual offender evaluation and treatment
DNA sample
Voting rights/Firearms restriction
Defendant eligible for any treatment programs available

records.addlTxt: from the Defendant to the Court regarding Petition for Sentence Adjustment
Revoked- Sentenced to Prison- Remains DOC collect
09:07 AM Defendant, Jacob H. Torkelson appeared. Jacob H. Torkelson appeared by video means. Called At 9:01 am. Discussions. Release date is 1/15/19. Court denies Petition & will sign an Order.

Hearing on December 11, 2018 at 09:00 am.
Defendant's copy provided to Jackson C.I.

Defendant, Jacob H. Torkelson appeared via video conference.  State does not appear for this matter.  Case called.  Defendant appears without counsel and this is the time and date to hear Defendant's petition.  Court did forward Defendant's petition to the District Attorney for comment.  Court did not receive a response from the District Attorney.  Court has reviewed Defendant's petition and letters.  Court addresses Defendant regarding programs.  Statements by Defendant regarding programs.  Defendant may be released homeless so he is hoping for more time to prepare living situation.  Defendant has spoken to parole officer about his release; inmate classification paperwork.  Court requests Defendant provide the Court will a copy of the inmate classification paperwork.  Court wants to allow District Attorney to response.  Court will consider inmate classification paperwork along with petition.  Court will reschedule this matter.
Hearing on October 23, 2018 at 09:30 am.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jacob H. Torkelson in court with attorney Justin D Wolff.  Kurt B Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Joint recommendation - Plea questionnaire provided to court - Statement as to negotiated plea provided -  Plea no contest - Waiver of rights and tendering plea - Waiver free and voluntary - Factual basis exists for plea - Found guilty by court - Statements by Wolff/Defendant to sentencing
Counselling as recommended by PO -  Undergo sexual offender eval and treatment - Straight sentence - 60 months initial  confinement - Credit for 110 days - 60 months extended supervision - DNA sample/surcharge - Voting rights - Firearms restriction -  Defendant eligible for CIP and SAP and any treatment available - CC/Surcharges - DNA sample - Any other crimes that could have arised out of this incident are dismissed and read in
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 12, 2014 at 10:30 am.
From Jacob Torkelson
Defendant
Not guilty plea

Defendant Jacob H. Torkelson in court, in custody with attorney Justin D. Wolff.  Donald J.
